chapter.title: Getting started with RDFBean
chapter.para:
In this chapter we develop a simple program using RDFBean, Maven, Eclipse, JUnit and Sesame's using an in-memory RDF storage engine.
The steps are * Maven configuration * Creating a holder class * Creating the domain classes * Testing via JUnit, that

sect1.title: Maven
sect1.programlisting:
pom.xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/maven-v4_0_0.xsd"> <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
<groupId>com.mysema.rdf</groupId> <artifactId>rdfbean-demo</artifactId> <version>0.1.0</version> <packaging>jar</packaging> <name>RDFBean Demo</name> <description>RDFBean Demo</description>
<properties> <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding> <!-- versions of dependencies --> <spring.version>2.5.5</spring.version> <rdfbean.version>0.7.4-SNAPSHOT</rdfbean.version> </properties>
<dependencies> <dependency> <groupId>com.mysema.rdf</groupId> <artifactId>rdfbean-sesame</artifactId> <version>${rdfbean.version}</version> </dependency>
<!-- Log using SLF4J over Log4J --> <dependency> <groupId>org.slf4j</groupId> <artifactId>slf4j-log4j12</artifactId> <version>1.5.2</version> </dependency>
<!-- testing --> <dependency> <groupId>junit</groupId> <artifactId>junit</artifactId> <version>4.4</version> <scope>test</scope> </dependency> </dependencies>
<build> <plugins> <plugin> <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId> <configuration> <source>1.6</source> <target>1.6</target> </configuration> </plugin> <!-- Querydsl APT processor that generates query model --> <plugin> <groupId>com.mysema.maven</groupId> <artifactId>maven-apt-plugin</artifactId> <version>0.2.0</version> <executions> <execution> <goals> <goal>process</goal> </goals> <configuration> <outputDirectory>target/generated-sources/java</outputDirectory> <processor>com.mysema.rdfbean.query.BeanAnnotationProcessor</processor> </configuration> </execution> </executions> </plugin> </plugins> </build> </project>
